page.title: 17Education in Arundel
page.content: There are three schools in the survey area; two state run primary schools and a private school. The{private school}is the New England College which is an American-run school for expatriate Americans in this country. The two state-run schools are both {church aided.}The Saint Philip's school is aided by the Roman Catholic church and has about 50 pupils. It is situated near the Cathedral. Arundel Church of England School shows its benefactors in its title and has about 200 pupils. It used to be in the building now housing the Library but moved to new accomodation in woodland in Stewards Copse in 1975. This survey was completed by the staff and children of Arundel Church of England School, co-ordinated by Mr. Haig.
